org.jgentleframework.context.beans
Interface ProviderAware

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractBaseController, AbstractBaseFactory, CommonPool, RmiBindingInstantiationInterceptor, RmiExporterProxyFactoryBean, RmiServiceExporterProcessor, ScriptingInstantiationInterceptor, StackPool, WeakPool
public interface ProviderAware

Interface to be implemented by beans that wish to be aware of their owning provider. After bean instantiation, container will automate invoke setProvider(Provider) method and pass the current provider to the argument of method.

Generally, beans donâ€™t know (or even need to know) their names, how they are instantiated or even that they are running within a JGentle container. This is usually a good thing because if a bean is aware of the container, then it becomes coupled with JGentle and may not be able to exist outside of the container. But sometimes, beans need to know more. Sometimes they need to know the truth who they are and where they are running.

For example, beans can look up collaborating beans, or definitions via the provider (Dependency Lookup). Note that most beans will choose to receive references to collaborating beans via corresponding bean properties or constructor arguments (Dependency Injection).

Note:

- The setProvider(Provider) method will be invoked before the Initializing.activate() method is invoked.

- For a list of all bean lifecycle methods, see the Initializing and Disposable.

Author:
LE QUOC CHUNG - mailto: skydunkpro@yahoo.com
See Also:
Initializing, InitializingMethod

Method Summary
 void setProvider(Provider provider)
          Callback that supplies the owning factory to a bean instance.
 

Method Detail

setProvider

void setProvider(Provider provider)
Callback that supplies the owning factory to a bean instance. Invoked after the population of normal bean properties but before an initialization callback such as Initializing.activate() or a custom init-method.

Parameters:
provider - owning Provider (never null).
